title: Share playlist as YouTube temporary playlist
body:
### Checklist - [x] I made sure that there are *no existing issues* - [open](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues) or [closed](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed) - which I could contribute my information to. - [x] I have read the [FAQ](https://newpipe.net/FAQ/) and my problem isn't listed. - [x] I'm aware that this is a request for NewPipe itself and that requests for adding a new service need to be made at [NewPipeExtractor](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/issues). - [x] I have taken the time to fill in all the required details. I understand that the feature request will be dismissed otherwise. - [x] This issue contains only one feature request. - [x] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md). ### Feature description YouTube has this URL that creates a playlist on the fly: http://www.youtube.com/watch_videos?video_ids=$videoIDs where `$videoIDs` is a comma-separated list of video IDs (`vid1,vid2,...,vidN`). For instance, this URL creates a playlist with 3 videos: http://www.youtube.com/watch_videos?video_ids=16J5TrCIEB4,8BsHd52ric0,nc_H-bD2khc The newly created playlist: * doesn't have a title * isn't associated with a YouTube account (you don't have to be logged in). * is temporary (I don't know exactly for how long it lasts, but if you save the URL (not this one, the _playlist URL_ that YT redirects you to upon creation) and try to view it again in a few days -- it's gone.) * Has a maximum length of 50 items. It would be great if NewPipe had an option to share a playlist in this format too. The "Share Playlist" dialog could have a a 3rd option called, e.g., "Share as YouTube temporary playlist".
### Why do you want this feature? This would be great for: * Sharing a playlist from your mobile to the desktop * Sharing with other people ### Additional information _No response_

body: ### Checklist - [X] I made sure that there are *no existing issues* - [open](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues) or [closed](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed) - which I could contribute my information to. - [X] I have read the [FAQ](https://newpipe.net/FAQ/) and my problem isn't listed. - [X] I'm aware that this is a request for NewPipe itself and that requests for adding a new service need to be made at [NewPipeExtractor](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/issues). - [X] I have taken the time to fill in all the required details. I understand that the feature request will be dismissed otherwise. - [X] This issue contains only one feature request. - [X] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md). ### Feature description I would like for Newpipe content to keep playing in the background after I have closed the app in the app overview (the 3 bar "button"/icon on the bottom left). This feature worked well without a problem on my Samsung A12 but doesn't appear to work on my new Samsung A13. There is an app called Music Player Go that I downloaded from F-Droid that allows me to do this. I can close the app while music is playing and the music does not stop. When I access the pull down menu by swiping from the top of the phone I have a simple preview bar with pause play for Music Player Go. I used to be able to do the same with Newpipe on my Samsung A12. I can no longer do this with the A13 for Newpipe. I have attached screenshots to help better visualize what I mean. I used Music Player Go because it functions exactly the way that I am requesting Newpipe work again. ### Why do you want this feature? There would be less UI clutter. There would be less apps to swipe through when I hit the android app overview "button" (the three bars on the bottom left of my Samsung A13). This allows me to scroll through only the high priority apps I want access to. ### Additional information

I think NewPipe do not handle this elegantly, as all the time i refresh the feed, those videos will be listed on the top. title: [YouTube] Support channel handles
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I am able to reproduce the bug with the [latest version](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/releases/latest).
- [X] I made sure that there are *no existing issues* - [open](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues) or [closed](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed) - which I could contribute my information to.
- [X] I have read the [FAQ](https://newpipe.net/FAQ/) and my problem isn't listed.

- [X] This issue contains only one bug.
- [X] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Affected version

0.24.0

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1. In a web browser click on link with '**handle URL**' in a form of `youtube.com/@[handle_ID]`

For example, try next handle URL: https://youtube.com/@app4soft

### Expected behavior

*NewPipe* should be associated with such '**handle URL**' links and open it as other YouTube-channels.

### Actual behavior

*NewPipe* does not associated with YouTube's new '**handle URL**' links.

### Screenshots/Screen recordings

_No response_

### Logs

_No response_

### Affected Android/Custom ROM version

Android 6.0

### Affected device model

_No response_

### Additional information

On October 10, 2022 YouTube introduced '**handle URL**' (`youtube.com/@[handle_ID]`) as a replacement to obsolete '**user URL**' (`youtube.com/user/[user_ID]`) and '**custom channel URL**' (`youtube.com/c/[custom_ID]`):

- https://blog.youtube/news-and-events/introducing-handles-a-new-way-to-identify-your-youtube-channel/

![img](https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/1_wDXB35T.max-1000x1000.png)

### Feature description

**Description:**
This is a bug report about components that have accessibility issues within the GUI of such an App.
Also, as the following Figure, this report focuses on the content GUI page in the App.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44084361/187605867-cf692c63-1637-456c-bc68-755751e6c1b3.png)
**Accessibility Issues:**
1. The buttons presented in Channel groups possess narrow intervals, resulting in visually impaired users might touch them by mistake.
2. The size of the buttons shown in Subscriptions is too small for visually impaired users.
**Appreciate**
I sincerely hope that these inaccessible issues could be repaired for the convenience of the visually impaired users.
Thanks a lot!


### Why do you want this feature?

Submitting this issue is an urgent hope that this App can better serve visually impaired users

### Additional information

_No response_

title: Show more useful message in error page
body: ### Checklist - [X] I made sure that there are *no existing issues* - [open](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues) or [closed](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed) - which I could contribute my information to. - [X] I'm aware that this is a request for NewPipe itself and that requests for adding a new service need to be made at [NewPipeExtractor](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/issues). - [X] I have taken the time to fill in all the required details. I understand that the feature request will be dismissed otherwise. - [X] This issue contains only one feature request. - [X] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md). ### Feature description Showing *video url* and probable *realtime announcement notice* in the error page which appears when NewPipe cannot play video. Below is a sketch map: ### Why do you want this feature? Sometimes a certain technical problem happens and NewPipe cannot work normally. Now the error page shows video name but no video link. A replicable and clickable link is useful for users who want to use other app or browser to watch the video. The error page does not show any interpretative statements for the error state, which may make users feel helpless. We can improve user experience and reduce probable duplicate and useless reports by adding a realtime announcement in the error page. ### Additional information You may create a text file that recording some urgent announcements on GitHub. When some systemmatic error happens, just let the client try to access the file and show it to users.

title: Drop support for Android 4.4 / Require Android 5 / API 21
body:
# [READ THIS FIRST](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues/7602#issuecomment-1006839893)

### Checklist
- [x] I checked, but didn't find any duplicates (open OR closed) of this issue in the repo. <!-- Seriously, check. O_O -->
- [x] I have read the contribution guidelines given at https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/HEAD/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md.
- [x] This issue contains only one feature request. I will open one issue for every feature I want to request.

#### What feature do you want?
Set the required Android version to 5 aka Android API 21 aka Android "Lollipop" or higher.

When creating a new project Android Studio currently recommends Android 6 / API 23.

I personally would drop support for everything that doesn't runs Android 7 / API 24, because nearly 90% ( keep in mind that this number will only increase) of all devices run Android 7+.

Btw: I think it would also be nice to declare/state somewhere that phones - which are using a newer Android version than provided by the original manufacturer - are not (officially) supported by us.
Example: The [OnePlus One](https://www.gsmarena.com/oneplus_one-6327.php) was originally updateable to Android 6 until the manufacturer dropped support for this phone. However if a user now installs a Custom ROM e.g. Android 11 and nothing works because the Hardware doesn't support some features which NewPipe (or ExoPlayer) requires and opens issues we are off the hook.

#### Why do you want this feature?
* Drop specialties (in the code) for old devices/Android versions.
Some examples:
  * https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/ee19ea66b3f4f182f78634c2d791dab6cab77257/app/src/main/java/org/schabi/newpipe/MainActivity.java#L134-L137
  * Media tunneling can be enabled by default
  * SAF checks for Android 4.4 can be removed
  * tons of other stuff see also https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/search?l=Java&q=KITKAT and https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/search?q=LOLLIPOP
* Less ``Call requires API level X (current min is 19): ...``-warnings
* We can close some (annoying) "doesn't work on my 7+ year old phone or set's it on fire"-issues
* Currently we can't update ~ExoPlayer as ``2.15+`` [requires Android API 21+](https://github.com/google/ExoPlayer/releases/tag/r2.15.0)~ OkHttp https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/ee19ea66b3f4f182f78634c2d791dab6cab77257/app/build.gradle#L233-L234
* According to Android Studio's "Android Platform/API Version Distribution" nearly 90% of all devices run on Android 7+
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40789489/147830366-9b7205f2-670f-4451-ba44-51306a50d9a0.png)
* Everything running not at least Android 9+ (API 28+) is getting no more security patches (from Google itself - depends in the end on the manufacturer): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Android_version_history

For comparison: [Android <4.4 support drop issue](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues/1871)

- [x] This issue contains only one feature request. I will open one issue for every feature I want to request.

#### What feature do you want?
<!-- Explain how you want the app's look or behavior to change to suit your needs. -->
When a downloaded video is being played, I want an option added to the three-dot menu. Currently, there are only two options there (loop and help/feedback). I want an additional button that says "pop-up/pop-out."
Talking about the thing in the top-right of the player.
![Screenshot_20211012-005813](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2876300/136894431-9cb04541-847d-430e-85ae-0dafc6cde793.png)

The new option should have identical functionality to the button "Pop out" shown here on the live YouTube browser part of the app and can reuse code. Feel free to make it a separate button instead of a drop-down depending on your UX goals.
![Screenshot_20211012-010324](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2876300/136894892-cb4b09d9-aaa8-43a8-ae67-1dbbd7bf2633.png)


#### Why do you want this feature?
<!-- Describe any problem or limitation you come across while using the app which would be solved by this feature. -->
I want this feature because I make very heavy use of both the download functionality (I ride subways and predownloading videos is the best way to avoid interruptions) and also the pop-out since I am a multitask addict. Combining these two features seems like a minor oversight that could be easily fixed, since both already exist in the codebase. It would make this app a 10/10 slam dunk for me and I would delete the native YouTube app.

Great job with this app by the way, already 9/10 and has become my go-to client in under a week, love that it is open source.

I'd like the clickable area of the buttons on bottom minimized video overlay (or how it's properly called) to be matching the height of the overlay.

The way buttons are currently configured isn't very ergonomic in my opinion. Their clickable area is kinda too small to tap, especially for users who have curved screen corners and don't use on screen navigation bar (like myself). Perhaps it looks better for some people the way it is, or there's some functional reason for it which I'm not aware of (?), but it seems to me that my suggestion would be ok to be implemented. Long press on each tab icon or scrolling down from title bar (in case of single tab enabled) should directly enter full screen and show related content on the right (landscape) or bottom (portrait). Player tabs on full screen should be swipable just like how they are on main player. So, seek position gesture should not work here. Video tabs' buttons and close button (floating on bottom right corner) should appearonly while scrolling content up. No need to show those buttons all the time.


Full screen tabs should be presented as following screenshot no matter which theme is selected. Each comment, segment and part of description should be presented in such curved parts. Applying dark theme on these parts will turn things weird. Unlike the screenshot, the contents should be placed on the right and each part should be curved on all four sides.

One more thing, these tabs should be hidden while showing the video interface.

Transcript tab: On the top of this tab, there should be two drop-down menus.
1. Captions
2. Audio tracks
Just like chapters, 'Transcript' should let us enter a certain timestamp. Unlike captions, it should only include the starting point of each segment. No need to show every single thing.

body:

#### Describe the feature you want
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you wish should happen.
Example: *I think it would be nice if you add feature Y which makes X possible.*

Optionally, also describe alternatives you've considered.
Example: *Z is also a good alternative. Not as good as Y, but at least...* or *I considered Z, but that didn't turn out to be a good idea because...* -->
Newpipe has an amazing UI for always ask share menu. Unfortunately, users can't choose an option for once at a time. Please be noted that these checkboxes will have to be checked or unchecked before choosing a playback option. These checkboxes should be kept unchecked by default.

1. Both unchecked: Same as 'Just once'
2. Checked "Remember my choice": Same as 'Always'
3. Checked "Remember my choice until app is manually closed": If the notification player or the app from recent apps is not manually closed, the app will remember the playback option.

Checking both options won't be possible as that doesn't make any sense. If a user checks both boxes, previously selected box will become unchecked automatically.

3. Users will be able to check boxes only when necessary.
4. Users will be able to binge-watch similar videos at a time without any hassle. (For example: Binge watching movie trailers, choosing popup again and again is required then which won't be necessary)

title: Add an "Always-on button" while playing video on full screen
body:
<!-- IF YOU DON'T FILL IN THE TEMPLATE PROPERLY, YOUR ISSUE IS LIABLE TO BE CLOSED. If you feel tired/lazy right now, open your issue some other time. We'll wait. -->


<!-- The comments between these brackets won't show up in the submitted issue (as you can see in the Preview). -->

#### Describe the feature you want
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you wish should happen.
Example: *I think it would be nice if you add feature Y which makes X possible.*

Optionally, also describe alternatives you've considered.
Example: *Z is also a good alternative. Not as good as Y, but at least...* or *I considered Z, but that didn't turn out to be a good idea because...* -->
Many functions while streaming videos is required. But the interface always has to be opened. An "Always-on button" can do all these things within a single tap. However, it might be disturbing for some users while streaming. So, an option to hide it should be kept too.


This option might be added optional in settings for every single type of playback. 1. Background, 2. Popup, 3. Full screen and 4. Main menu. This will make switching much easier. For background, always-on button on the bottom right corner of the media player functions.

If a single action for the button, single tap on "Always-on button" should directly perform that action. However, if multiple actions are selected, always-on pallet will be shown.
![IMG_20210314_125908](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79245641/111061776-1f1ca600-84cf-11eb-98f1-22a76044a17f.jpg)

Tapping once again on the centre button of the pallet or always-on button should close the pallet.

I think more than four options will make the UI too overcrowded. So, it should be limited to four. However, users should be able to choose between one, two, three or four actions.

Positions for the options of always-on pallet should be customisable just like the options for Content on Main Page

Always-on button should be stay hidden when the video is locked or video interface is shown.

 Following options will be helpful.
1. Pause/Resume: First tap will pause the video, show always-on button pallet (if pallet is supposed to stay) and hide video interface Tapping elsewhere the pallet will hide the pallet Video interface should never be shown as that is what never meant to be shown.
2. Pause+Take screenshot/Resume: First tap will pause the video and take the screenshot of the current time. The screenshot will not be stretched or zoomed or show the buttons. Rather, it should be alike an original shot directly from the video. The options in next screenshot might be added while taking screenshot. A checkbox for "Delete after sharing" should be added above the screenshot pallet. It should stay unchecked by default. A "Screenshot" tab should be included in the options drawer as well.
![IMG_20210314_140925](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79245641/111061730-ef6d9e00-84ce-11eb-95fb-ad689e2782c3.jpg)
3. Switch to background
4. Switch to popup
5. Switch to full screen
6. Switch to main
7. Loop: First tap will be regarded as starting point. Second tap will be regarded as ending point and the selected part will be looped.
8. Repeat: Three options (1. Don't repeat, 2. Repeat only this, 3. Repeat All) will be added just like media player functions for background.
9. Lock: First tap will lock the screen and place the "Unlock" button on the top left corner. However, always-on button's previous position should not get changed. It should be hidden while locked. But it will return to its previous place when the video is unlocked.
10. Fit/Fill/Zoom: This option should fit or fill or zoom the video in cyclic order just how as we do on video interface. Single tap for fit, double tap for fill, tripple tap for zoom, fourth tap for fit again and so on. 
11. Choose playback speed 1X, a.bcX, d.efX: Actually, most of us need only certain playback speed options. For example, I watch my news videos at 1.75X, but I watch music videos at 1X speed. It should also follow the cyclic order of fit/fill/zoom. Speed options should stay unhooked. a.bcX, d.efX, p.qrX etc. options should be customisable by the user.
12. Share video URL
13. Share video URL at current time
14. Download
15 Open with browser
16. Open with external player
17. Choose captions
18. Search with the captions: Really useful if captions are not downloaded but user still wants to listen to a basic part.

#### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe it
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Maybe the developers and the community could brainstorm and come up with a better solution to your problem. If they exist, link to related Issues and/or PRs for developers to keep track easier.
Example: *I want to do X, but there is no way to do it.* -->



#### Additional context
<!-- Add any other context, like screenshots, about the feature request here.
Example: *Here's a photo of my cat!* -->



#### How will you/everyone benefit from this feature?
<!-- Convince us! How does it change your NewPipe experience and/or your life?
The better this paragraph is, the more likely a developer will think about working on it.
Example: *This feature will help us colonize the galaxy! -->
Newpipe has no option to do them within a single tap. Especially, taking screenshot is a hassle. First, show interface. Second, pause the video. Third, hide interface. Fourth, take screenshot. Although, it can be don

An Always-on button will also be able to avoid obstructing playback as necessary icons will be shown as only frequent actions will be shown in one place. This will also help to hide unnecessary actions.

Video interface won't be overcrowded anymore if new features are added.

#### Describe the feature you want
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you wish should happen.
Example: *I think it would be nice if you add feature Y which makes X possible.*

Optionally, also describe alternatives you've considered.
Example: *Z is also a good alternative. Not as good as Y, but at least...* or *I considered Z, but that didn't turn out to be a good idea because...* -->
"Created playlists" tab should be brought in order to keep playlists created by the user. This will help reduce conflict and keep all the playlists in a proper way. Others' playlists should be kept in "Bookmarked playlists".


Downloaded playlists: Each playlist should have download time (from when the download started) grayed out (just like channel name under video). There should be 4 tabs within each playlist. Default sorting for playlist could be "Recent" (just like downloads).
All: Show all videos as a usual playlist, just with download and remove date and time under the title bar. This tab should be exclusive for changing positions of videos as creating changes in other tabs may cause conflicts.
Downloaded: Show downloadeded and offline available videos. "Download" option in long press menu should still remain as other resolutions might be required. File will be replaced automatically if same resolution for same file is selected. Recent downloaded file should appear at first in the playlist by default.
Removed: Once downloaded, later file removed from the device. However, the files should be accessed through online, not offline. If the files are opened online, they should play on the same resolution as they would if remain downloaded.
Not downloaded: Saved under the playlist, but not downloaded.

Downloaded playlist should not get affected (Affects include removal of videos, adding videos by original playlist). Rather, it should be regarded as a new and independent playlist. Downloaded playlists should not get imported or exported. (We see the same for "Downloads" menu). Unlike created playlists, new videos cannot be added in downloaded playlists.

Videos selected through bulk selection or single video download should be included in downloaded playlists. Instead, if a user downloads the playlist from long press menu (mentioned in #5782) that playlist should be considered for downloaded playlist.

A checkbox above the download selection page could be added.for confirmation. It should be checked by default. Sorry for my poor editing.
![IMG_20210410_150153](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79245641/114264612-beb94f80-9a0d-11eb-8683-6929c74c5d9b.jpg)


As mentioned earlier, only last modifications before first download of the playlists should be included for "Downloaded playlists" However, downloading videos from the "Downloaded playlist" should include downloaded videos.

"Downloaded playlists" and "Downloaded files" should be two different menus. They should have separate downloads. They should not get mixed up.

It should have variable grid options (Same as "Downloads") for both playlists and videos.

Three dots menu for playlist and long press menu for playlist and video should be as same as for downloaded playlists just like created playlists.

title: Usebasic function shortcuts on swiping left and right for bulk selection and playlists
body:
<!-- IF YOU DON'T FILL IN THE TEMPLATE PROPERLY, YOUR ISSUE IS LIABLE TO BE CLOSED. If you feel tired/lazy right now, open your issue some other time. We'll wait. -->


<!-- The comments between these brackets won't show up in the submitted issue (as you can see in the Preview). -->

### Checklist
<!-- This checklist is COMPULSORY. The first box has been checked for you to show you how it is done. -->

- [x] I checked, but didn't find any duplicates (open OR closed) of this issue in the repo. <!-- Seriously, check. O_O -->

- [x] This issue contains only one feature request. I will open one issue for every feature I want to request.


#### Describe the feature you want
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you wish should happen.
Example: *I think it would be nice if you add feature Y which makes X possible.*

Optionally, also describe alternatives you've considered.
Example: *Z is also a good alternative. Not as good as Y, but at least...* or *I considered Z, but that didn't turn out to be a good idea because...* -->
Sometimes, we need to choose a lot of videos for bulk selection. Somehow, we need all videos but have chosen to the wrong action for a few videos. The case might be opposite too. We want to select all videos. But the actions will be performed in seperate ways. In such cases, swiping left and right gestures might be helpful. Screenshots are here for better understanding my need. Sorry for my bad editing.

Most people will prefer swiping right for removing videos. However, there are left handed people too. This is why, both swiping left and right should be customisable for different actions.


In my opinion, basic functions include
1. Remove
2. Download
3. Add to popup
4. Add to background
5. Add to main
6. Add to playlist
7. Share

Users may need to do same actions with selected videos. That's why, bulk selection menu should be dismissed only after choosing 'Close' (or 'Cancel') option.

Once bulk selection is activated, an easy video selection gesture should be usable. This gesture could activate bulk selection as well. The reason why I want to keep long press on bulk selection is that users may want a simple common gesture as different views have different gestures.

For list and 11 grid view: Scroll through thumbnails
For grid view: Swipe through the videos with two fingers continuously.

The positions of selected videos should be readjustable just like playlists or enqeued lists.
#### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe it
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Maybe the developers and the community could brainstorm and come up with a better solution to your problem. If they exist, link to related Issues and/or PRs for developers to keep track easier.

More options can be added in three dots menu on the right of top bar.
1. Remove from playlist (exclusive for created playlists)
2. Add to main
3. Checkbox for "Exclude other actioned videos": If checked, swiped (but not removed) videos will be excluded from main action.

![IMG_20210402_103742](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79245641/113380982-91cac400-939f-11eb-9abc-4343b3fd1b3f.jpg)

Thanks for this great app (v0.20.8)
I have some suggestions to make the Andoid TV UI better, this because the current NewPipe UI is optimized for smartphone/tablet use and not for a TV with a remote controller.
So here are some points of interest to tweak the UI for Andoid TV's:
- Add a setting to "force" Andoid TV UI with:
	- Removing number 1 and 2 and place them in the menu (pic 2);
	- Sadly I am unable to close a video I watched (number 3), so remove this or add a new function (press back to make it small, press back again to close);
	- When you are on one of the videos on the left (pic 1, eg Michou) and than press left, it should open the menu as in pic2;
	- Playing a video in fullscreen is quite hard to do, so is it possible to make somekind of button in the video pop-up to play a video fullscreen?. maybe also add these: (back 10sec, full screen/small screen, pauze,close video, advance 10sec. when pressing down it should go to the timeline of the video) ; 
	- If possible, add a feature to update the app from wihtin newpipe. My TV sucks when using a browser and does not give me the pup-up for a new version...;
	- Refressing the playlist is also hard to do, I suggest making a "long press to refresh" function to refresh the playlist.

![np1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76731207/103280141-ebea7080-49cf-11eb-8ace-3e637859475b.png)
![np2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76731207/103280157-f3aa1500-49cf-11eb-80b8-6cbeb99c75b4.png)

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Implement horizontal video seeking (like VLC has)
body:
<!-- IF YOU DON'T FILL IN THE TEMPLATE PROPERLY, YOUR ISSUE IS LIABLE TO BE CLOSED. If you feel tired/lazy right now, open your issue some other time. We'll wait. -->

#### Describe the feature you want
Vertical swiping currently allows us to adjust brightness and volume.

VLC also has horizontal swiping to seek back and forward in the video. It also shows how far you're seeking, eg `+10 (1:10)` or `-15 (0:45)`

This would be a handy feature!

Pic of VLC video controls:

title: [feature request] few small modifications to AndroidManifest.xml - global hardware acceleration and large heap - massive performance improvement for low-end devices.
body: I found that the following modifications to the android manifest xml, result with a much better performances on several low-end devices. android:hardwareAccelerated="true" android:largeHeap="true". and (optionally) ![Screenshot_20201021-052437-01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/415238/96665867-8722f200-135e-11eb-9580-609dba2ba9ee.jpeg) Optionally for production builds I set explicitly: android:debuggable="false" android:appCategory="productivity". And this was meant for for a 'straight up' http connection android:usesCleartextTraffic="true" but it makes connections less buggy for some reason on any protocol. not sure why. all those are added to <application to effect all views/activities. newpipe_v198.0.22.2_mod_nolanguages_hardwareacceleration_nodebug_oldui_newextractor_signed_aligned.apk.zip NewPipe_v0.20.2_mod_nodebug_nolanguages_largeheap_globalhardwareaccelerated_signed_aligned.apk.zip I'm doing my modding the lazy way with APKTool, then sign with my generic keystore and 4byte align. since I prefer the default English I also delete all of the languages (original APK is about 7.5MB, modded one is 4.80MB) all reference is in android developer docs... (yes, lazy). edit: https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/graphics/hardware-accel#application-level, https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/application-element#hwaccel. https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/application-element#largeHeap. note: since I use a different signature you need to uninstall previous versions if you want to install it (can still import settings of course..).

title: support a head-up-display mode (HUD)
body: OK, this is really quirky suggestion, If you're not familiar with a HUD ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Head-up_display ) its a simplified control-set where all the fine-tweaks and knobs are hidden, replaced with a very big, clean UI, usually it is also named 'driving mode'. Not implying that one should 'youtube and drive' (seems risky as much as 'drink and drive' if not more), HUD sometimes supports horizontal mirroring of the UI, which makes it usable a a partially reflected image through the drivers' windshield (assuming one is safely parking of course). This allows videos (and subtitles) to be viewed correctly after being reflected, and it's kind-of like watching a cinema in your car. Cool factor aside ()*: I've just wanted 'HUD way of watching videos' for a long time, I never found a 3rd-party app that will allow globally mirroring of the entire device's content, (maybe Xposed-framework will be suitable for that...) And the closest I've came is a firefox-addon that allows youtube (website) to be mirrored, https://github.com/eladkarako/chrome_extensions/blob/store/MirrorX/README.md Just want to leave this one here, and hear your thoughts... ( )

title: NewPipe can't be resized
body:
### Version
- [`0.19.5` from F-Droid](https://f-droid.org/en/packages/org.schabi.newpipe/#0.19.5)

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1. Open NewPipe app on an Android Desktop environment
2. Try to resize it

### Expected behavior

Resizing is possible

### Actual behaviour

It's not resizable via dragging borders or corners and the resizing button is greyed out

### Screenshots/Screen recordings

As you can see the resizing button is greyed out:
![NewPipe on Samsung DeX](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/372620/88523995-16876600-cff9-11ea-9462-8084d886ba03.jpg)

### Additional context

I'm using [Samsung DeX](https://www.samsung.com/us/explore/dex/), which gives a desktop like experience and makes use of Android windowing support.

[Samsung has documentation on how to enable window resizing](https://developer.samsung.com/samsung-dex/modify-optimizing.html):

```xml
<application
    android:resizeableActivity="true">
</application>
```

This documentation also has more tweaks and information on how to improve the desktop experience in case you're interested.
They also have [an app testing guide](https://developer.samsung.com/samsung-dex/testing.html) (although some apps are fine with this guide but won't work on "real" DeX sometimes).

Applications like Firefox, VLC or Termux can be resized without any problems.

**PS:** I know that it is possible to _force_ all apps to be resizable via `Samsung Labs` > `Force Resize` but it would obviously better to make the application natively resizable to create less friction.
**PPS:** I'm not sure whether this is relevant but [this](https://codeberg.org/gitnex/GitNex/pulls/601/files) is how GitNex fixed the issue.
**PPPS:** There's also [this blog post](https://blog.iamsuleiman.com/prepare-apps-multi-window-in-android-n/) that looks helpful.

title: Design proposals
body:
First of all: NewPipe is so great! I really like it so my criticism is "Grumbling at a high level" as we say in Germany. NewPipe looks good. But I want it to look _**best**_. So I've decided to make the following design proposals. Unfortunately, I have no clue how to design an Android app so I can only contribute some example images.

# **1) Better context menu** 
In my opinion, it takes the user too long to understand what all the options mean. The context menu lacks good distinguishability of the individual items. So this is my proposal: add icons, group the items and put the share option as an icon to the top. Also, the video title needs to be really emphazised because it just gets kinda lost. By the way: those are Bootstrap icons. I created the last 2 ones myself from existing ones.  And maybe make the edges more rounded.

![NewPipe new context menu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52963327/88476588-fdaf7f80-cf28-11ea-96db-bdc164937398.png)

# **2) Swipe to delete home tab**
You can delete a home tab by dragging/sliding it in the settings to the right out of the window. There should be a red indicator.

![NewPipe swipe to delete](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52963327/88468764-de3c3680-ced7-11ea-92a3-2fa93138fb3b.png)

# **3) PeerTube instances**
In the left menu you can select PeerTube as the video source. But if you have several PeerTube instances NewPipe gives you this little really annoying dropdown menu which I'd like to have replaced by a grouped/seperated list.

![NewPipe PeerTube](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52963327/88468846-bbf6e880-ced8-11ea-9ee5-4635bc47c08a.png)

# **4) Pull to refresh**
Please add the option to pull-refresh the feed tab. Searching and unsuccessfully tapping the little, little reload button is sooo annoying.

![NewPipe pull to refresh](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52963327/88468880-2f005f00-ced9-11ea-8d16-a09bf1d240d6.png)

Thanks for your work! Love it

title: Unify playback queues and notifications for background/pop-up player
body:
#### Context
If a video is started in the background and another video is started in the pop-up player, there are two playback notifications. When the user taps on the notifications, they can view the two different playback queues for the background and the pop-up player.

![20200604_102633](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61639215/83733507-e69d9100-a64d-11ea-8acb-f4367aa325d6.jpg)


#### Feature request
Merge the two queues for the background and the pop-up player into a single one that is used for all playback modes.
Show the same notification for the pop-up player as for background playback. When a video is started in a different playback mode (background/pop-up) or the playback mode is switched, the notification has to control the player (background or pop-up player) that is currently playing.
I.e. if the pop-up player is open all the time but a video is started in background mode, from that point the notification has to change to the video that is played in the background until the pop-up playback is continued.


#### User benefit
Usually, every media player has a playback queue. But not more than one. It's known to the users and expected that way. It's convenient because it's simple, common and it doesn't work any worse.
There is just no point in having multiple playback queues for one app that can only play one video at a time. It's only extra load that doesn't bring any advantage.

The same explanation applies for the duplicate playback notification. Currently, two notifications are necessary to access the different playback queues. Beyond that, it's only annoying that basically the same notification can be displayed twice while at the same time only one of them has an actual purpose. It doesn't make any sense that the pop-up player notification is different. It misses the skip buttons and the progress bar. Apart from that there is no difference, so it could as well be only one notification.

#### Related problems
The disadvantages described in this issue are related to a different problem in issue 'Background/pop-up/full-screen players open at the same time' #3737.
In that issue I stated that it's unnecessary to have different players open at the same time, as only one can play at a time, anyway. The fact that pop-up player and background playback can be open simultaneously is the condition for the two notifications showing up at the same time. Still, it is an independent problem that there are two different notifications in the first place.
Also the transition from which playback mode is controlled by a single notification (background or pop-up mode) would be easier if their was only one playback mode open at a time.

title: Fast actions from mini info item - UI / UX ideas
body:
# Problem
I have been thinking about the long press menu lately, and I realized it is inconvenient because:
1. Entries have no corresponding icon, so our eyes can't distinguish between two entries at the first sight.
2. Entries are not always in the same position on the screen, so we can't use muscle memory. Even though this was partially addressed by #2354 & #2368, the position of entries depends anyway on the menu length.
3. There are too many entries, making the menu too crowded, and there are many requests for new entries (#437 #2198 #2510 #1142).
4. There is no way to select multiple streams and apply an action on all of them.

# Solution
This is the solution I propose, sorry for the bad quality ;-)

![menu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36421898/64062305-08607800-cbe5-11e9-97d1-7e9ea0f9a6cd.jpg)

Screen A contains normal info item list. By tapping on the blue *stream* info item we get to screen B. Yes, video info is not loaded, instead the item expands to show some action buttons above and below it! Here is why I think this is a good idea:
- Most of the times when I click on a video I just want to play it, and currently I have to wait for video info to load before being able to play anything (#2306). With this solution it would take less time.
- Video info can be loaded by clicking again on the item.
- Icons are always in the same place (relative to the clicked stream) and with the same icon (no text, as icons are representative enough). This solves problems 1. and 2. above. Also, actions about stream content (play&download) are separated from the specific ones that only use stream info (add-to-playlist, share, delete-from-playlist, set-as-playlist-thumbnail, etc.).
- Since play-actions are displayed where the item was before, and the item is shifted down (see how the above separator is not moved in screen B), one can remember where an option is and double-tap in the correct place directly from screen A. This would take no time.
- Background and popup play buttons can be long-pressed to enqueue (consistent with the video info activity).
- There is place for new actions, in case we ever need them. We would just need to add a button to the bar below the item.

By long-pressing on the blue *stream* info item on screen A, the multiple-select options are shown in the action bar (similar to https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues/2354#issuecomment-494871457), solving the problem 4. above. By tapping once on any other *stream* info items we can select them, getting to situation C. A tick is displayed above selected items' thumbnails and the action bar is populated with actions about stream content.
The three-dot menu cointains the other actions and also two options useful for selection purposes: "select below" and "select above", only available in non-infinite lists. These can be considered a replacement to a "select all" button, but are more powerful and would solve #2510 #2559. If a playlist is long and is not fully loaded, the "select below" button would lazily select all items so that they are loaded only if needed. 

# Feedback
I would implement this but I need feedback both from designers and from users. Would this idea suit your needs? Would it be pleasant to the eye? If you disagree with any of the assumptions I made above, be sure to tell me ;-)

@theScrabi @TobiGr @TheAssassin @nv95 @Gymcap @karyogamy @justanidea @Lirlisa @gkeegan @BartFarley @xak2000 @jojoxl01

title: Proper Feed UI
body:
[![Bountysource](https://api.bountysource.com/badge/issue?issue_id=49721213)](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/49721213-subscription-order?utm_source=49721213&utm_medium=shield&utm_campaign=ISSUE_BADGE)

So guys I promised that I would think about a proper way of implementing feeds for subscriptions.

Here is my suggestion.

## The subscription Window

![feed_channel](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/40890240-44584004-6773-11e8-806a-53474c0a443f.png)

Like in a typical RSS app you would see the new/unseen videos of a channel by an Indicator in each item.

## The Feed Window

![feed_screen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/40890247-6f9275d2-6773-11e8-8d85-b5df0ad5441c.png)

- Sorted by time ;D
- Shows __all__ the new/unseen videos of a channel not just the newsest one

## Channel Window

![highlight](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/40890366-255e9944-6775-11e8-90cb-d026b58712f5.png)

New Videos of a subscribed channel will be highlighted.

# Bonus goodies

- Notifying the user if a new video is available.

# How it's done

Believe it or not, but some preparation work has already been done regarding this topic ;)

### Preparations on the Database
So when @karyogamy  designed the Database he created the two tables [Stream](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/app/src/main/java/org/schabi/newpipe/database/stream/dao/StreamDAO.java) and [StreamHistory](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/app/src/main/java/org/schabi/newpipe/database/history/dao/StreamHistoryDAO.java).  By applying __``Stream \ StreamHistory``__ you can find the so called Orphanes. These are streams that are not yet in the history but still listed in the streams table. @karyogamy  Maybe these can be used to indicate not yet seen videos.

### Preperations on detecting the time
Since time on youtube videos is a little complicated to parse the NewPipe Extractor always returned the creation time of a video as a String not as a number. This however makes it complicated if you want to track the time for a feed database. Luckily @mauriciocolli created the [time ago parser](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/tree/master/timeago-parser) project with which is possible to convert the Youtube time ago strings into rough time estimations.

Also for some youtube channels a RSS feed is available, however wee still need a fallback because not all channels have RSS.

### What still needs to be done
- [x] Well the extractor still returns a String for the time, so the time ago parser should be used for youtube to return a `long` instead.
- [x] The [StreamEntity](https://github.com/teamnewpipe/newpipe/blob/dev/app/src/main/java/org/schabi/newpipe/database/stream/model/StreamEntity.java) needs to get a row with the creation date.

title: [Feature request]Setting to limit mobile data usage
body:
- [x] I carefully read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/HEAD/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) and agree to them.
- [x] I checked if the issue/feature exists in the latest version.

When I use NewPipe outside of my home I always switch to 144p to avoid eating up my data plan. This is annoying and I often forget. Could you add an option to limit bandwidth usage when off of wifi?
Instead of adding four additional non-wifi Default XXXX options you could add just one:

Settings option:
**Limit mobile data usage**

Choices:

| Label | Action |
| --- | --- |
| No change | Stick with user chosen defaults |
| Play video and audio at a reduced quality | Reduce resolution and format for the lowest bandwidth consumption |

title: Issues with Live Streaming
body:
I'm sorry I merged the livestream feature before it got tested.
So here are some thoughts and impressions of mine:

- [x] __New instead of Sync__
On the player if you have live stream, on the right side you see the word Sync. However I found it a little more conveniend and intuitive if it was called Now instead.
![sync](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/37354284-9381a77e-26e1-11e8-82ae-972f9512e928.png)


- [x] __New streams shouldn't start at the beginning but on "now"__
As a noop I expect a live stream to be "live" when i start it. However it confused me that the live stream starts at the beginning and not at the "now". It took me some time until I realized the picture I saw was not "now", and I had to scroll forward.  However I witnessed that when I lock and unlock the phone we are "live" again.
![start_at_beginning](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/37354331-afaa0392-26e1-11e8-8709-dcfa72e44f65.png)

- [x] __Confusing display where we are in the stream__
Also the number showing where we are currently in the stream jumpt arround wildly, even sometimes jumping to a minus value. That confused me.
![confusing_display](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1891273/37354353-bf04eea6-26e1-11e8-9486-8964ea1b11a3.png)

title: Other Services UI
body:
## @TobiGr wrote [here](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/issues/4#issuecomment-318929045):

@wb9688 It's a great idea to add SoundCloud to NewPipe! Thank's for your work.
> Btw do we already have ideas for NewPipe's GUI? I was thinking about something like [this](https://i.imgur.com/CbAfzsC.gifv).

Since tabs will be introduced with TeamNewPipe/NewPipe#620 soon, another bar on the top of the screen doesn't seem to be a good solution to me. I thought a little about this problem and found two possible solutions:

1. **Refactor the search filter menu:** remove the old list and add clickable items. This gives the user the possibility to search for things in Youtube _and_ SoundCloud at the same time.
![search](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17365767/28756762-0727cb00-7575-11e7-88d8-34ad76bb44ad.jpg)
First sketch: default search bar Second sketch: Search bar after clicking on the filter icon (maybe the filter icon should not disappear to be accessible for further actions). The clickable items should have different background colors depending on their state.

2. **Add navigation drawer to app:** replace the old menu in the app bar by a navigation drawer. This solution gives the app a more modern look and separates all services.
![design](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17365767/28756763-072e3a80-7575-11e7-809c-e655a608861c.jpg)

title: Design and theme issues
body:
I have found some cases where the current theme is not applied to all elements and only the light theme is displayed. - [X] The item / folder picker in the settings has only a light theme (this dialog is called when the user wants to change the video / audio download path). - [X] The menu in the tool bar in the about activity has only a light theme too. - [x] The license dialog's content (=> the license's file) is a HTML file. Can we apply our themes to it, too? If yes I'd suggest to color the links red and maybe to not underline them. I also found some inconsistent styles and views: - [ ] While the link to the about activity exists in the main activity there is no link to it in the tool bar of the downloads activity.
- [X] While the tool bar's text color is dark in the main, downloads and settings activities, it is white in the about activity when the light theme is applied. I think white looks better. What do you think?
Maybe we also should change the color of the border at the bottom of the fragment's titles (ABOUT/LICENSES) to a ligth gray wich is used for the main text in the light theme.
- [ ] The license dialogs have no separators which separate the dialog's header and footer from the main content as it's done in the settings (e.g. at preferred content language setting).

title: New icon
body:
While NewPipe app interface follows Material Design, its icon doesn't and seems NewPipe needs a new icon. I'm not a designer, just suggesting an idea so I quickly made a sample icon below. Also when you launch NewPipe app, big ugly playback symbol appears on the screen. Instead NewPipe needs a new modern logo or NewPipe can just simply display the list of recommended videos just like YouTube app. I highly recommend the second one.
